conclusion: Determine the refraction angle when the light enters the Dawes prism and check if the light can exit from edge CD.
The light ray enters the prism parallel to the base CD.
The incident angle with respect to the normal at point A is 45° because the prism is an isosceles right-angle prism.
Snell's Law: n1 * sin(theta_i) = n2 * sin(theta_r).
n1 is the refractive index of air (n1 = 1), n2 is the refractive index of the prism glass (n2 = sqrt(2)), theta_i is the incident angle (45°), theta_r is the refraction angle.
Plugging in the values: 1 * sin(45°) = sqrt(2) * sin(theta_r).
Check for total internal reflection at edge CD.
The critical angle theta_c is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/n2.
The angle of incidence at CD is the same as the angle of refraction at A, which is 30°.
Since 30° is less than the critical angle of 45°, the light will not undergo total internal reflection and will exit from edge CD.
The refraction angle when the light enters the Dawes prism is 30°. The light can exit from edge CD.
